segments.text: Ugh, that sink is disgusting with water everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's just pouring over, soaking the cabinets like filth.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman's foot in that dirty puddle—gross.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's polishing that plate, but the whole area's a mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Those kids climbing for cookies in this slop.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy's hand in the jar, stool tilting—nasty if he falls in water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's reaching; they'll track that wetness everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Puddle widening, probably breeding germs on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't stand seeing the overflow ruin the kitchen like this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Even the window view can't clean up this revolting sight.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Dish towel bunched up, but it's all pointless now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Secret cookie theft on top of the flood—appalling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cabinets' doors dripping; what a filthy disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR
